intro: Oxytropis maydelliana, commonly known as Maydell's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow pea-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis maydelliana is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a distinctive appearance that makes it recognizable in its native habitat.
